text: 2 hours 35 minutes (train from St. Moritz to Tirano) and 3 hours 10 minutes (bus from Tirano to Lugano) 156 kilometres (97 miles) on the train, 90 kilometres ( 56 miles) on the bus The Bernina Express runs from May through November between St. Moritz and Tirano. From Chur to Tirano, it runs all year round. Unfortunately, their schedule is too complicated to put into words. Please check their current timetable to put together your itinerary. Travelling on the Bernina Express requires a seat reservation. The seat reservation costs between 20 CHF and 26 CHF, depending on the season you travel in. You can buy your seat reservation for the Bernina Express in just a few clicks on Swiss Activities. The same principle that works for the Glacier Express applies to the Bernina Express. To avoid paying the reservation fee , use regular trains. Get on in Chur or St. Moritz and travel to Tirano. This way, you can also get off along the way as much as you like because trains run every hour.
